name: Museum of the Earth
reviews: [{'text': 'My son has been really into dinosaurs recently so we went to the museum during one of their free days (Jan-March). Wasnt overly crowded, staff and volunteers were attentive and offered information. There was a nice selection of hands on activities and a few play areas throughout.', 'author_name': 'Kelsey', 'relative_time_description': '4 weeks ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': "A lot of neat stuff to look at. Bigger than it looks. Took about an hour to go through. Went with kids of the age 5 and 6. They were somewhat interested. A lot of rocks and fossils made up a majority of the Museum. My biggest complaint was the gift shop.... Very un organized and a lot of the items didn't have prices. The admission desk is the same desk to cash out. Also very overpriced.", 'author_name': 'Eric Coryell', 'relative_time_description': '2 weeks ago', 'rating': 3}, {'text': "Went on a day when the admission was free.  I'm generally a huge fan of museums and their service to the community--however there is barely an hour or two worth of material to explore at this one.  I can't say it's worth the high price of admission.", 'author_name': 'Christopher Parzyck', 'relative_time_description': 'a month ago', 'rating': 2}, {'text': 'Very nice place, but could use a lot more things for kids to do. It seemed like nobody works on weekends only the gift shop and the front desk, so they can make money...', 'author_name': 'blanca compton', 'relative_time_description': 'a week ago', 'rating': 4}, {'text': "Wonderful small museum. They usually have a special changing exhibit which is always cool.if you haven't been to the area a lot and want to learn more about the area this is a great place to learn about the gorge and the ice age. Definitely worth checking out if you've never been before.", 'author_name': 'JoeBruceMock', 'relative_time_description': '3 months ago', 'rating': 5}]

name: Sciencenter
reviews:
[{'text': 'Liked this place very much, there were some really neat exhibits. We loved the water exhibit and the big blue building blocks. We weren‚Äôt able to do the outside part because of the weather but are definitely looking forward to it next time we are in town!', 'author_name': 'Allison Stier', 'relative_time_description': '3 weeks ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': 'The kids absolutely love it. There is plenty to do there and there is something for everyone, including they really young children. It usually takes us a while to convince the kids it is time to go! Great pricing too and they truly make it affordable for everyone!', 'author_name': 'Melissa DeFord', 'relative_time_description': 'in the last week', 'rating': 5}, {'text': "This place is amazing for children and adults! They have many different interactive things to do! The staff is extremely helpful and educated! I also love all the artwork that is outside in the parking lot, it's a mosaic and it's absolutely stunning!", 'author_name': 'Lauralee Voy', 'relative_time_description': '2 months ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': 'Great place to bring kids of all ages. My two year old daughter had a blast. Amazing value for the very low cost of admission.', 'author_name': "Sean O'Brien", 'relative_time_description': '2 weeks ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': 'I loved this place as a kid. They always had changing exhibits so there was always something new to see. My favorite thing there hands down was the water dam with the rubber ducks.

The outdoor area was great for running around and getting your engery out. There were also a couple of small live creatures on display that they would sometimes take out and show you.

It is a great family experience and I recommend going here.', 'author_name': 'JoeBruceMock', 'relative_time_description': '2 weeks ago', 'rating': 5}]

name: Herbert F. Johnson Museum of Art
reviews: [{'text': 'This is a really outstanding art museum. The architecture is a little outdated and feels odd on the campus, but it‚Äôs definitely standing out. Inside the museum I‚Äôm not in love with the layout. It‚Äôs very easy to get lost in the maze and the stairwells are weird. But that‚Äôs all perfectly okay because the range and quality of the art is incredible! After a few hours I‚Äôm still wanting to stick around a revisit a few pieces.', 'author_name': 'Clifford King', 'relative_time_description': 'in the last week', 'rating': 5}, {'text': 'I love it! Worth every bit of the travel out here from Ohio. If you are planning to go, make sure you set aside at least a few hours. As for me, I could have spent the whole day! There is so much to learn and experience there, truly amazing. I will be returning the next chance I get!', 'author_name': 'danielle dimitriou', 'relative_time_description': '2 months ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': 'What a delightful way to spend a beautiful Sunday morning. The "Moon" exhibit alone is worthwhile. There is more stuff that we want to see, so we\'ll return. The view from the 5th floor windows is spectacular.', 'author_name': 'Jim Savitt', 'relative_time_description': '3 months ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': 'My wife and I enjoyed this relatively small but beautiful museum. It has a diverse collection for a free experience. The deck outside the second floor is a must. You will see what I mean when you go.\nAdmission is free. Parking is limited. Combine the museum with a short walk across the road to the Cornell suspension bridge to get a wonderful view of the gorge and waterfall', 'author_name': 'Michael Ramsburg', 'relative_time_description': '6 months ago', 'rating': 4}, {'text': 'Awesome free museum. Worth checking out for sure.', 'author_name': 'Zachary Stansell', 'relative_time_description': 'a week ago', 'rating': 5}]

name: Ports of New York Winery
reviews: [{'text': "Gosh where do I begin with the amazing experience my friends and I had at this winery! There is a certain charm about this family-owned boutique winery. The story behind the winery, the wine maker and the wines made our visit so special. We highly recommend Frederick's port wines! Will visit again for sure.", 'author_name': 'Penn Libellus', 'relative_time_description': '5 months ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': 'A truly great winery with a truly beautiful couple at the helm. The visit and tasting was great. An Ithaca treasure.', 'author_name': 'Robin Presthus', 'relative_time_description': '2 months ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': "We stopped by without appointment and the owner was friendly and welcoming. He gave a nice brief yet personal tour that lasted about 45 minutes and included a nice story about his family's wine making history in France. There were two table wines and two ports for tasting and all were superb and easy to drink. Highly recommend if you have a free hour.", 'author_name': 'Gary Coffman', 'relative_time_description': '8 months ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': "The owner is very nice and intelligent person, it's was a great experience with good wine üç∑ the cost for the testing is 5$ and it include an explanation.", 'author_name': '◊©◊ó◊® ◊ò◊ú', 'relative_time_description': '4 months ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': 'Do I love Ithaca so much that I will drink her wine? Yes I do. Since I discovered Ports of NY, there is a bottle or two of the red Meleau port in my home at all times. I will have a small glass of it at odd times, including when I make a steak. Love it.', 'author_name': 'Bob Carson', 'relative_time_description': '7 months ago', 'rating': 5}]

name: Handwerker Gallery
reviews: [{'text': '', 'author_name': 'Meredith A Palmer', 'relative_time_description': '3 months ago', 'rating': 5}]

name: Lhb Hortorium Museum
reviews: [{'text': '', 'author_name': 'ËëâÊùæÁìö', 'relative_time_description': 'a year ago', 'rating': 4}]

name: Ithaca's Discovery Trail
reviews: [{'text': '', 'author_name': 'Juliana rodriguez fuentes', 'relative_time_description': '8 months ago', 'rating': 5}]

name: Carl Sagan Planetwalk - Cascadilla Creek crossing at the Planetary Footbridge
reviews: [{'text': "This is such a beautiful walk and it's really sweet seeing other people on the trail ducking into shops to get their sagan stamps. Such a thoughtful tribute!", 'author_name': 'Tali Cherniawsky', 'relative_time_description': '6 months ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': 'You have to do this walk! I promise you will learn something new.', 'author_name': 'Daniel Winne', 'relative_time_description': '8 months ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': '', 'author_name': 'Doug Phunny', 'relative_time_description': '5 months ago', 'rating': 5}]

name: Discovery Center of the Southern Tier
reviews: [{'text': "Great visit.  I highly recommend this place. !! My Grandkids love this place.    Always an adventure .. from the hot air balloons and airplanes.  To the fire truck. To the acting stage to the pirates ship and the grocery store .. we loved the underground tunnels and all of the adventures to be had at the Discovery center .   They have made many improvements over the years .  I must say. .  can't wait to take them back again when we have more time ..  thanks so much for providing a place for learning , fun, and development .  A  much needed asset to the community .", 'author_name': 'melissa bogert', 'relative_time_description': 'a month ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': "This looks like a really nice place.  We visited in Winter so all the fun outside stuff was covered in snow unfortunately.  Inside was fairly well maintained but once it stated getting busy there just isn't enough room inside.", 'author_name': 'Gunit Word', 'relative_time_description': 'a month ago', 'rating': 4}, {'text': "The Discovery Center is hands down one of the most interesting and unique places I have visited, whether in the US or abroad. There are a variety of activities for children and it's easy to socialize with other adults as well. This place has great reviews, and for great reasons! Check it out, bring your kids, you will all quickly fall for it's charm! A++", 'author_name': 'TreeSpider', 'relative_time_description': '2 months ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': "This place continues to be top notch even after all these years. Great for kids to explore, learn, and run their crazies out. If you've never been before, think of a giant place with all kinds of pretend play. From a mini grocery store, to a bank, to a restaurant, an old fire engine (that my grandfather used to drive), and countless other activities. There are even quiet areas tucked away for children who need sensory breaks. During holidays they like to decorate accordingly and do a great job. Prices are very reasonable and well worth it (they even have grandparent memberships so they can take their grandchildren). While there (if the weather is decent), check out the storybook garden. It's a free play area with gardens, books to read, and fun stuff for kids to explore. There is even a pavilion area if you wanted to bring a lunch or snack. If you have never been here, go! Don't  just think about it, GO! You won't be disappointed", 'author_name': 'Joshua Faughnan', 'relative_time_description': '6 months ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': "Disappointing, I remember how incredible it was a few years back and they have changed a lot lately. I \nam frequently there for work. Electronic stuff that usually is in working condition, has not been recently. Changed a whole room to just coloring, I could do that for free at home, don't need to pay $8 to do that. Lots of parts have just changed to puzzels and reading, not as interactive as in the past. All on top of the fact they have upped the prices. The kids I work with are upset about the changes.", 'author_name': 'cass m', 'relative_time_description': '2 months ago', 'rating': 2}]

name: Roberson Museum and Science Center
reviews: [{'text': "Recently had an event at the mansion's ballroom.  It is a beautiful space.  While you have to provide everything but the tables & chairs, the staff worked with me to get all my decorations and dessert, plates, napkins, etc up to the top floor.  It really is a blank canvas that you can make as formal or informal as you wish.  Everyone had a great time, and then spent some time wandering around the rest of the mansion and museum.", 'author_name': 'jacquelyn gunn', 'relative_time_description': 'a week ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': "Walked through when the Christmas trees were set up. Definitely very informative and interesting to see all the different countries and the decor they use. The train display was amazing, some serious effort was put into that setup that can't be ignored. Highly recommend getting a guided tour to fully appreciate the history of the house. We didn't get the tour and ended up not being that impressed but historical locations aren't high on our visit list and we had a 2 year old who wouldn't have lasted.", 'author_name': 'Brad Antczak', 'relative_time_description': 'a month ago', 'rating': 4}, {'text': "Very cool attraction to visit whether you are coming in from out of town or a local. There's a famous Christmas tree exhibit every year, several photography and art exhibits and a massive model train that showcases historical parts of the Southern Tier, perfect for adults and children alike. My favorite part of the museum is the planetarium, the shows there are fascinating and the staff is extremely knowledgeable and entertaining. Worth checking out!", 'author_name': 'Joshua Witter', 'relative_time_description': '2 months ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': 'We come every Christmas.  We love the Christmas Tree Forest,  the train display and all of the beautiful rooms in the mansion. The art is just an added bonus.', 'author_name': 'Rene√© Matarese', 'relative_time_description': '3 months ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': 'Great local museum with something for everyone! Love the Christmas trees and the model trains.', 'author_name': 'Jonathan Mawdsley', 'relative_time_description': '2 months ago', 'rating': 5}]

name: Phelps Mansion Museum
reviews: [{'text': 'Saw the theatrical event Never more there, it was a very good setting for the show. Antique furniture, paintings, molding, & elaborate chandeliers. Great place to tour if you are interested in history.', 'author_name': 'Tammy Coroa', 'relative_time_description': 'a month ago', 'rating': 4}, {'text': 'Really nice place. The house was decorated for Christmas, and it looked beautiful. The tour guide had lots of information on the house and the Binghamton area. It is worth checking out.', 'author_name': 'Tyler Lewis', 'relative_time_description': '3 months ago', 'rating': 4}, {'text': 'Nevermore is a great show in a breathtaking location!  Wonderful and timeless.', 'author_name': 'Teal Yajko', 'relative_time_description': '2 months ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': 'Beautiful home.  The tour was wonderful.', 'author_name': 'Missy S', 'relative_time_description': '2 months ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': "Tour was a bit boring, the guides done it so much theres no enthusiasm left. I'd stop listening after maybe a minute in each room and just explore the artifacts, read things myself.", 'author_name': 'CheyenneSinful', 'relative_time_description': '4 months ago', 'rating': 3}]

name: Binghamton University Art Museum
reviews: [{'text': 'I used to go here all the time when I was in school. Really great place to stop by in between classes or just when you are looking for something to do.', 'author_name': 'Nicole Campise', 'relative_time_description': '6 months ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': 'Very beautiful and educational place to go', 'author_name': 'Jacqueline Rose', 'relative_time_description': '5 months ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': '', 'author_name': 'Abagael Rudock', 'relative_time_description': '2 weeks ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': '', 'author_name': 'Zuzu Boomer-Knapp', 'relative_time_description': '10 months ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': '', 'author_name': 'Luna Moreno', 'relative_time_description': '10 months ago', 'rating': 2}]

name: Broome County Historical Society
reviews: [{'text': 'Best library!!!', 'author_name': 'Mary Chadwick', 'relative_time_description': '3 months ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': '', 'author_name': 'Chris Roma', 'relative_time_description': 'a year ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': '', 'author_name': 'Craig Kilroy', 'relative_time_description': 'a year ago', 'rating': 5}]

name: Steamtown National Historic Site
reviews: [{'text': 'If you are into old trains this is the place for you.  You can spend 3 to 4 hours no problem if you read all of the information on the different displays. It has a working reconditioning/maintenance shop. A trolley museum on site also. Parking is not a problem and easy to locate.', 'author_name': 'Mike Reed', 'relative_time_description': '2 weeks ago', 'rating': 4}, {'text': 'Great area to look at some history of Scranton PA. This place is huge so a bit a walking around cant hurt anyone. Speaking of which this place is great for handicapped people. Place stays clean and staff is very friendly and kind with warm hearts to go around. Been here a while and 5 out of 5 is what it deserves from me. I take in every detail of the place and there is a lot to be discovered with beautiful scenery.', 'author_name': 'Hell Blazers', 'relative_time_description': '2 months ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': "A fascinating historic site full of industrial artifacts. Will have to visit for the labor day steam workshop and locomotives. I can't believe these things still run. It's like visiting another time and place. One of America's prides. Steam locomotives don't get bigger than big boy.", 'author_name': 'Matthew Hickey', 'relative_time_description': 'a week ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': "Great place to go learn about the history of railroads. Very family friendly and easy to find. When you are walking through the yard be sure to check all the tracks you're crossing since it is still an active railway", 'author_name': 'Bryan Melliand', 'relative_time_description': '4 weeks ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': "This gem of historical and educational artifacts is right up the street from my home and is still a regular stop of mine when new kids come into my circle of family friends.\nIt's not only a nice tourist attraction but I also love to take pictures of my clients there on the grounds. My grandson likes to just roam around and explore the tracks and old engines. If you have kids, don't miss it!", 'author_name': 'Michael Melisky', 'relative_time_description': '2 months ago', 'rating': 5}]

name: Everhart Museum
reviews: [{'text': 'Took our 9 yr. Old granddaughter to her first museum.  Loved the birds.  Nice to have in my back yard.', 'author_name': 'Lorraine Williams', 'relative_time_description': 'in the last week', 'rating': 4}, {'text': 'A local treat, perfect for a relaxing weekend excursion.\n\n The bird collection is always fascinating, even if some pieces are starting to show their age (100+ years by the way!), and the rotating exhibits bring some interesting pieces that would be difficult to find anywhere else (like the skateboard deck and Haitian voodoo flag displays in the past). Just make sure you wear a hoodie! It gets mighty cold in the bird exhibit.', 'author_name': 'Blake Belleman', 'relative_time_description': '3 weeks ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': 'This is a very interesting museum.  I liked the diverse collection which ranges from dinosaurs to fine art', 'author_name': 'Raymond Ellis', 'relative_time_description': '3 weeks ago', 'rating': 4}, {'text': 'Though there were a few exhibits off-limits due to being updated the exhibits that were open are quite lovely. The staff was very nice and helpful ,and the gift shop had a little something for everyone. Also the Great Lawn outside of the museum on a nice day is a great place to stroll with the family, with the lovely Koi pond in the front.', 'author_name': 'Laura Leon', 'relative_time_description': '6 months ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': 'What an amazing place! We took visiting friends with children here to fill part of the afternoon. We all had a wonderful time and the price cant be beet! The surrounding grounds are beautiful and the park across from the museum has lots more fun things to see and do that will tire even the most out of control children.  "tree house" :)', 'author_name': 'Anonymous A Google User', 'relative_time_description': '7 months ago', 'rating': 5}]

name: Electric City Trolley Museum
reviews:
[{'text': "Spectacular!!!!! This museum is just amazing. I love these fringes-of-history type places. Such interesting stuff. We came in the winter-cant wait to come back in summer and ride the trolley! Scranton has such a neat history. You gotta see this place, also, you can't miss the Oliver train. What a funny thing. Nice people, lots of parking too.", 'author_name': 'Liam Tahaney', 'relative_time_description': '2 months ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': 'Well priced and tons to do there for all age ranges. The gift shop had reasonably priced products for sale as well. We enjoyed our visit and would love to return soon.', 'author_name': 'Bryan Torres', 'relative_time_description': 'a month ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': "This is a fine museum and there are some interesting exhibits, specifically the close look at how the trolleys were powered and a cut-away that shows the drive system in a restored trolley. 

That said, it's fairly small for how much it costs to get in. It also seemed like there were many exhibits that simply weren't up to par with the rest of the museum, to the point that some cases didn't even have labels to explain what was inside of them. 

Still very much worth stopping in and checking out, especially if you're already going to Steamtown which shares a parking lot with the Trolley Museum.", 'author_name': 'Tom Nardi', 'relative_time_description': '2 months ago', 'rating': 4}, {'text': 'Great staff! Fun day trip, and inexpensive. Great for little ones of all ages.', 'author_name': 'Heather Macaluso', 'relative_time_description': 'in the last week', 'rating': 5}, {'text': 'Went today with co-workers to buy gifts from the gift shop. We arrived at 345pm knowing that they close at 4pm. We found the doors locked and when an employee opened the door he was adamant that he would not take care of us. When asked why he said that "we do not close at 4pm we LEAVE at 4pm". He continued to tell us the cash registers were already locked and he said to come back in the morning. Is it any wonder why Scranton is broke when it's own employees refuse to make a sale. SMH', 'author_name': 'En Elisseou', 'relative_time_description': 'a month ago', 'rating': 1}]

name: Scranton Iron Furnaces
reviews: [{'text': 'Nice little spot to stop and walk through. Very interesting history and neat to see up close.', 'author_name': 'Helen Rebernik', 'relative_time_description': '2 months ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': 'Great place to learn some history And you can have a wedding their also every October their is a bonfire you can go to and get food and drinks and learn about the iron furnaces good place for kids and adults', 'author_name': 'Brian dippel', 'relative_time_description': '4 months ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': "Impressive relic of Scranton's industry. There isn't much to see but the massive arches of the furnace are interesting. Great place to stop if you happen to pass by.", 'author_name': 'Kenneth Gaughan', 'relative_time_description': '7 months ago', 'rating': 3}, {'text': "There wasn't a lot to see. But we always enjoy learning about the history of places we visit. This is just a nice place to stop for a few minutes.", 'author_name': 'radine riedesel', 'relative_time_description': '9 months ago', 'rating': 3}, {'text': 'A lovely place to take in some history.  Very well placed markers with lots of information.', 'author_name': 'Nayda Figueroa', 'relative_time_description': '7 months ago', 'rating': 5}]

name: Catlin House Museum
reviews: [{'text': '', 'author_name': 'Beverly Tomek', 'relative_time_description': '2 months ago', 'rating': 5}]

name: Miniature Memories
reviews: [{'text': '', 'author_name': 'Ronald Bryndza', 'relative_time_description': '8 months ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': '', 'author_name': 'Bert Goessens', 'relative_time_description': '3 years ago', 'rating': 2}]

name: Dunmore Tank Memorial
reviews: [{'text': 'Well maintained tank in the center of the square.', 'author_name': 'Austin LaLonde', 'relative_time_description': '9 months ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': 'Nice tribute to vets', 'author_name': 'John Gilhooley', 'relative_time_description': 'a year ago', 'rating': 5}]

name: Toy Soldier Museum
reviews: [{'text': 'If you are a history buff or an Anglophile this intimate private collection museum is a hidden jewel. Tours by appointment. Hand made diaramas have been featured in Hollywood movies.', 'author_name': 'Chris Merli', 'relative_time_description': 'a week ago', 'rating': 5}]

name: Newark Museum
reviews:
[{'text': "A place where I used to visits with my boys! A lot of amazing things to learn. They have workshops and also have activities for the kids & families. You will definitely learn a thing or 2 that you never knew. Behind the museum they have a fire house that's awesome to visit along with a school with school furniture &supplies from years ago so u can see how kids used to attend school. Great Place FREE for Newark Residents", 'author_name': 'Dana Martinez', 'relative_time_description': '2 weeks ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': 'I grew up with the Newark Museum in my backyard and although moving (not far away) I still try to get there as often as I can - renewed my affair when facilitating youth groups (once saw Whitney backing up her Mom Cissy during Black Hx Month). Then bringing my young daughter for workshops, performances and/or just spending a day - free. I try to remember to renew my membership so I can enjoy the vast array of exhibits, events and full life the museum offers', 'author_name': 'Dorothy Jones', 'relative_time_description': 'in the last week', 'rating': 5}, {'text': "The Newark Museum is always doing something innovative. 

This evening I visited the museum for the opening of the 'Wendy Red Star' exhibition and they had a very nice Members Cocktail Party and opening of the exhibit. They really did a nice job. We even got to meet the artist.

The museum is always trying to create different venues for the patrons and this exhibition showed the artists life from childhood until now and the changes that the laws on the Reservations have done to the people that live there. It was interesting to see the progression.

The opening party was very nice and the caterer did a good job with the food. It was just a nice evening oul", 'author_name': 'Patricia Thomas', 'relative_time_description': '2 weeks ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': 'How did I not know how great this place is? It is huge and filled with all kinds of interesting exhibits from different cultures and time periods. There is even a restored house inside it. We probably only saw 2/3 of it. We will have to come back. The staff is friendly. They have a AAA discount. The museum shop is nice. Also there is a small sculpture garden and old schoolhouse in back.', 'author_name': 'Nancy LaParo', 'relative_time_description': '2 months ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': 'The Nina Simone Thursday event was fun. There was great music, head wrap tutorials, selfie art projects and delicious bites. I love this museum and look forward to all the events they have.', 'author_name': 'Tydera Faines', 'relative_time_description': 'a week ago', 'rating': 5}]

name: Thomas Edison National Historical Park
reviews: [{'text': 'What a cool museum. The rangers and volunteers are knowledge and very happy to answer your questions. I highly recommend giving yourself plenty of time for your visit because there is so much to see and enjoy.', 'author_name': 'Nicholas Downham', 'relative_time_description': '2 weeks ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': "A fascinating piece of history worth visiting. And quite aside from the remarkable artifacts of Edison's day, it puts the advancement of science and technology into perspective. I hadn't realized that Edison pioneered medical x-rays or that some of the cars of his day were powered by batteries he developed.", 'author_name': 'Remon Lapid', 'relative_time_description': 'a month ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': "Very neat very educational. Lot of history to you. The factory tour is really neat. Even if you're not a fan of Thomas Edison there is a great piece of History.", 'author_name': 'Justine Miller', 'relative_time_description': 'a week ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': 'One of the coolest museum I have ever been to everything is left the way Edison had it when he died. You can literally reach out and touch a hundred years of history well worth it.', 'author_name': 'Garrett Hamelers', 'relative_time_description': 'a week ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': "I really enjoyed the experience, I had went there with my school as a field trip. I had enjoyed what I've seen and the guide was so nice and answered all if our questions. I would totally recommend going here to anyone!", 'author_name': 'Kayla Tutten', 'relative_time_description': 'a month ago', 'rating': 5}]

name: Montclair Art Museum
reviews: [{'text': 'One of best place to have a day with family.  kids love to have a art class with local artists.', 'author_name': 'Frank Lynch', 'relative_time_description': 'a year ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': 'I went here with my kids today and it was a horrible experience, not because our kids were badly behaved but because the staff there were very harshly behaving to the kids and in general very rude. I personally heard one staff member rebuking the kids saying they were being ridiculous when the kids were only five. I also witnessed one of the security members pushing a kid causing him to fall just because he was standing too close to a painting. Horribly mannered staff.', 'author_name': 'Harin Joh', 'relative_time_description': '8 months ago', 'rating': 1}, {'text': 'My first time visiting; what a lovely, friendly place! Matisse exhibit was illuminating. Will definitely be returning soon with my husband.', 'author_name': 'Barbara Berger', 'relative_time_description': 'a year ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': 'This is where i come to have peace of mind. Staff is always helpful and friendly. They also have alot of pottery and art classes. I highly recommend the art class hosted by terri bertolo. She is a great teacher. She has definitely enhanced my ability to draw live models. Class is reasonably priced and she always snacks for the guests.', 'author_name': 'Shaniece Degazon', 'relative_time_description': 'a year ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': 'Great museum!', 'author_name': 'David L', 'relative_time_description': '7 months ago', 'rating': 5}]

name: Liberty Hall Museum
reviews: [{'text': 'Very cute, the fire trucks are awesome!! The first floor of the Kane home is decorated for Christmas which was lovely. Would have like to seen the rest of the home which is open during other times of the year. John, our tour guide was super knowledgeable and very sweet!', 'author_name': 'Brianne Grant', 'relative_time_description': '3 months ago', 'rating': 4}, {'text': 'Pond is well kept,  nice place for quiet time.', 'author_name': 'John Longo', 'relative_time_description': 'a week ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': 'Love me some dark haunted tours!! Be careful what you HUNT for ;) -Paranormal Investigator', 'author_name': 'Tammy Schweiger', 'relative_time_description': '2 months ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': "Beautiful grounds to walk around with apple trees and gardens and roses as well as multiple buildings that were part of Mr. Livingston's estate. He was the first elected governor of New Jersey, and the Livingston/Kean family has lived there in the past 200 years. The family has been influencing American politics on every level since then. Now the grounds are part of Kean, but can be rented out for events. The gardens are great for ceremonies and the carriage house is a beautiful brick building for small gatherings. They offer tours of the main house and there is a lot of historical information as well. I was there for a wedding which was amazing with a large tent set up by the carriage house, but I want to go back to take a tour and learn more about the history of this amazing estate.", 'author_name': 'Danny Rowland', 'relative_time_description': '6 months ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': 'Great place for kids. The grounds are beautiful. I went for the pumpkin festival and there were many activities.  But always bring more money because in addition to the ticket prices, a lot of stuff inside is additional $$$.', 'author_name': 'Narima Deen', 'relative_time_description': '4 months ago', 'rating': 5}]

name: The Jewish Museum of New Jersey
reviews:
[{'text': 'Best kept secret of old Jewish Newark. 
The Jewish Museum of New Jersey is housed at historic congregation Ahavat Shalom, the longest continually operational synagogue in Newark.

Currently the museum is only open Sundays, but it is definitely worth the visit', 'author_name': 'Yitzchok Moully', 'relative_time_description': '5 months ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': 'Went her for a NJPAC Arts event. Very nice.', 'author_name': 'Janet Irby-Miller', 'relative_time_description': '4 months ago', 'rating': 3}, {'text': 'Cong. Ahavas Shalom/The Jewish Museum of New Jersey. The only active Shul left in Newark, NJ.', 'author_name': 'Henry London', 'relative_time_description': '10 months ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': '‚ÄúJazz Events‚Äù
This is a small museum, inside a Synagogue, that has good free attractions during the year. I have been to a good amount of them. It is worth the trip when they are open.', 'author_name': 'Ora Cooper', 'relative_time_description': '2 years ago', 'rating': 4}, {'text': 'Good', 'author_name': 'Charles Wilson', 'relative_time_description': '3 months ago', 'rating': 5}]

name: Jersey Explorer Children's Museum
reviews: [{'text': 'Had the pleasure of working with the crew.. So heart broken to hear about Gary retiring! He absolutely gives and gave his ALL to this place!! The staff is amazing.. The concept of this place is AMAZING!! I absolutely love it! & ppl instead of judging this place help build it up!! This place is truly a gem üíé! Children should definitely get a chance to experience it!! Keep it up guys!!! Hey garyyyy!', 'author_name': 'Stephanie Matos', 'relative_time_description': '2 months ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': 'Great children party location. Gary was patient in showing everyone about the museum and took his time with the kids explaining about all the different exhibits. Great place for all ages.', 'author_name': 'Vinessa Gillette', 'relative_time_description': '5 months ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': 'Hidden adventure for kids and parents. Highly recommended.', 'author_name': 'Leighton DeGoede', 'relative_time_description': '4 months ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': 'Great place to take young kids', 'author_name': 'Louise Scott', 'relative_time_description': '3 months ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': "I don't know how people can give this place a 4 or 5 stars review. We just went with our class and this place is completely broken. We found a lot of unsafe things for children. Staff is very friendly and the concept is good but the place is definitely old and dirty. Check before going. The only good thing about it? We got free books for our children.", 'author_name': 'laura chcc', 'relative_time_description': 'a year ago', 'rating': 2}]

name: GRAMMY Museum Experience Prudential Center
reviews: [{'text': "The grammy museum experience was a  beautiful display if you loved Whitney Houston especially. My daughter loves Whitney so I found out about it and brought her there it's right in the Prudential center in Newark New Jersey we were able to park on the street and we went during the day on a Friday and it was very quiet so she got to try all different types of musical instruments she got to sing in a microphone To Ray Charles she got to see a whole wardrobe of Whitney Houston and also a bunch of other New Jersey Musicians stories and Such. They had a small gift shop with tshirts. The staff was pleasant and it was kept very clean.", 'author_name': 'GROWING UP LALICATA', 'relative_time_description': '2 weeks ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': "This was a cool experience.  There were lots of interactive musical toys to play with and lots of photo ops.  The staff were really nice too.  Definitely check it out, it's a fun thing to do for the family for an inexpensive price.", 'author_name': 'Chevy Bee', 'relative_time_description': '3 months ago', 'rating': 4}, {'text': 'Kinda small. But really nice. The interactive drum simulation with The Mighty Max Weinberg was really fun. 10 bucks for admission.', 'author_name': 'David Nichnadowicz', 'relative_time_description': '3 months ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': 'Awesome. Was going to Prudential to see SWV BabyFace and Toni. They were hosting a pre show party. One comp drink (your choices.were beer or wine.  A little disappointing) however we did Karoke the host was delightful. The exhibits were phenomenal. There was a large one of Whitney. Nice place to start a great evening.', 'author_name': 'Estrella Briggs', 'relative_time_description': 'a month ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': 'Very nice tribute to Whitney and fun singing of sorts.', 'author_name': 'Brenda Freeman', 'relative_time_description': '4 weeks ago', 'rating': 4}]

name: Durand Hedden House & Garden Association
reviews: [{'text': 'Fun to visit with friends (if you have friends)', 'author_name': 'Miles Mu', 'relative_time_description': '3 months ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': 'Yummy pizza, great lunch specials', 'author_name': 'Mariela Dybner', 'relative_time_description': 'a month ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': 'Almost every local kid is toured through this deliberately plain museum in elementary school, probably because middle schoolers would realize how boring it is. We were taken on a walk through this house that is noteable solely for never having been changed for several centuries, even though not much history had ever happened there. It is a museum meant to show you that things were different before electricity and provides little else. I remember being shown how to make maize from corn meal more than I remember why we were on a field trip there in the first place. It is certainly a boring, "George Washington slept here once"-type of museum.', 'author_name': 'Sam Skoller', 'relative_time_description': '9 months ago', 'rating': 1}, {'text': 'I wish I had visited here when I first moved to Maplewood., but am delighted I have been going regularly for a decade or more now.  Very informative.  Particularly interesting if you own an old house and love the town.', 'author_name': 'Timothy David GILL', 'relative_time_description': 'a year ago', 'rating': 5}, {'text': 'Historic house hosts historical happenings.  Very good presentation commemorating 100th anniversary of United States entrance into World War I.', 'author_name': 'Evan Brody', 'relative_time_description': 'a year ago', 'rating': 5}]
